docs.lead_paragraph: At a combination hotel and laboratory in downtown Boston, guests are cloistered for months while scientists feed them with painstaking care. The idea is to see how diet affects the process of growing old. If the research succeeds, the scientists say, they may be able to find ways for people to help preserve their bodies far into their retirement years simply by watching what they eat. The scientists are working at the United States Department of Agriculture Human Nutrition Research Center on Aging at Tufts University.

headline.main: CENTER STUDYING DIET'S LINKS TO AGING
